intro: Elatostema ficoides var. brachyodontum, commonly known as the broad-leafed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically found in the axils of the leaves. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
